data.title: Great food
data.text: My family and I went here by the suggestion from the people at Robert Is Here.  There aren't a whole lot of Mexican choices around Miami lakes. So when we were told about this place we jumped on it.  Sure glad we did.

data.title: delicious food
data.text: Great customer service- our waitress was attentive and friendly.  The food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  If we return to the area we will be back!

data.title: AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD
data.text: I love this restaurant because I found a real Mexican flavor, fresh and tasty food, prompt service, nice live music. Great tacos, zarapes and salads excellent soup, all meals that I tried were good!!!

data.title: taco barrato
data.text: torro taco has the bestinchiladas the service is very good , they do not have alcohol but you can bring your own which make the evening cheaper.

data.title: Best Taco's I've ever eaten.
data.text: And the place was  very clean with a price that won't break your wallet. All the triming were very fresh,and the Hot Sauce on every table was all I can say is WOW.

data.title: Mexican
data.text: This was highly recommended to us as genuine Mexican. All I can say is, I hope not. Just very bland boiled everything served by grumpy people bored by our lack of Spanish. I'm sorry I don't speak great espanol, but your food could be a lot better

data.title: Dissapointed
data.text: The place needs serious cleaning. It took the waitress a long time to take my order and the check was given to me half way through my food. The food was not so good. First time I visit an "authentic Mexican restaurant" in south Miami where the personnel refuses to speak spanish. Not coming back.

data.title: Do Yourself A Favor And Keep Heading North
data.text: Very poor service and terrible food are only a few of the reasons I will never set foot in this place again. Three times I have had bad experiences, and seriously, I am not giving them a fourth chance. I can spend my money on better things. Bad management, but someone is paying for PR since people keep going there (don't ask me why).

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
I have been going to this restaurant for years now. My last visit was two weekends ago; we got there at about 6pm and there was barely any place to sit, not because the place was full, but it was dirty, tables had not been cleared and it seemed they had been there for a very long time. Apparently, they had a problem with the air conditioning and they had a small fan for the whole restaurant. Even though there were only 3 or 4 other tables, it took them a while to approach us. Our waitress was quite nice, but just assumed we knew Mexican food (no recommendation whatsoever), so we ordered the fiesta platter (what I always order); this platter as a sampler has one of each (sorry I can never remember their names!) it's about $10 and it's definitely a big portion, it used to be delicious and you could tell the difference, now it all tastes the same, it took them quite a while to serve us too. It is a cheap restaurant and food used to be really good. Unfortunately, they haven't moved on with the times, and food is only average, I would even dare say another Taco Bell, which is absolutely not good at all to me.
The whole restaurant looked unkept and dirty, no one cares about the place, let alone the costumer. When you are done, they give you the check and you have to go and pay yourself at the register. 
This restaurant has been opened for ages now and they still don't have a liquor license; you can take your liquor, fair enough, but the one thing you crave when having Mexican food is a margarita.
It really is a shame how disappointing this place has turned. I will not come back at all, it just doesn't make any sense to me, such weird business (if you can call it that).

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Good waitress good food except no AC inside . And don't go to the bathroom because when you come back table will be cleaned even if your not done eating then they want to charge . Last time I'll go here

data.title: Real Mexican food!
data.text: We have been going to el toro taco for over 10 years. It is a family run business that offers authentic Mexican fare. The best part is that you can bring your own beer!  Don't miss this gem!!👍👍👍

data.title: Yummy
data.text: The bean dip is amazing! Had a fiesta platter and everything was hot fresh and yummy! Quick friendly service. Far for me but super worth it!

data.title: Really a 3.5 out of 5.
data.text: My wife likes their chile rellenos, but it is a dumpy sort of place. Their bathrooms are funky and it's not super clean. Overall, I would rate their food as decent. We only visit this restaurant during our yearly visit to the everglades. I'm sure there are better Mexican ( and probably cleaner) places nearby that we don't know about.

data.title: Best burritos anywhere.
data.text: I live in Homestead and find I must eat here at least once a month.  The beef burrito is the best I have ever eaten, and I have eaten a lot of burritos around ;the world.

data.title: Good food but place is very filthy.
data.text: We stopped for lunch and enjoyed the food very much but could not get past how filthy, overall, the place was. Bathroom was really bad, looked like it was cleaned last century. No kidding. The ceiling of the restaurant had weird things hanging all over and trash bags. NO I would  not go back.

data.title: The Real Thing ...
data.text:
If you are in the mood for real authentic Mexican food, this is the spot in Homestead Fl.
My wife and I had different meals and both tasted as good as they looked. The only regret we had was we wished we would have found out about them earlier in the week so we could have eaten there more than once. We met the owner and family and had great service. We will be back !

data.title: Good food and value!
data.text:
Reasonably priced Mexican food that is well prepared. Guacamole and salsa very good and not over-processed. Beef had some interesting spices but not overwhelming. As previously noted, you must bring your own alcoholic beverages. Service a bit uneven, but owner was very pleasant.
I would certainly eat there again!

data.title: No liquor license. Sucked anyway.
data.text: Maybe this is common in S. Florida but this place did not have an ABC license. That was vaguely ok with my group, so the waiter vaguely directed me to a place across the street and that establishment vaguely agreed to sell me 4 beers to take back to the Mexican restaurant. The waiter said he would bring an ice bucket for those beers but it took 3 requests to receive it. Unlike every other Mexican restaurant that I've ever been to;  tortilla chips are not delivered immediately. In fact the guacamole we ordered came only with a small basket of chips ( $7.95 seemed excessive). Meals were unexceptional. The fajitas came on 1 plate and were much smaller than I'm accustomed to seeing. Vegetarian platter boring. Service was slow. We got the wrong order the first time served. Maybe this is considered authentic but it just seemed well worn and uninspired.

data.title: Real Mexican!
data.text: Awesome place for a good mexican dinner. bring your own beer, the Food is great, authentic and everybody there is friendly! worth to experience

data.title: Good food...Service in need of overhaul!
data.text: Have been coming to ETT since mid 90s.  Always great food.  The quality I'd the meat, the shredded beef, the ground beef and the chicken is second to none  BUT YOU WILL HAVE TO WAIT..not because the restaurant is full.  I do not know what has happened but I beg for Hector (owner) to bring back his magic touch (which you used to experience on crowded weekend nights with great service and awesome food.   FOR NOW...be aware.  Ask about kitchen wait times to turn around orders.  Also when you walk in, look to see menus on  tables with customers growing inpatient.
